recent_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
recent_posts.summary:
- Two papers criticized for incorrect assumptions about Bitcoin's security model and its trustless payment capabilities.
- The assumption of oracles or altchains enabling trustless payments compromises Bitcoin's security.
- Maintaining a nash equilibrium between miners is crucial for Bitcoin's security and censorship prevention.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP now includes a DH cryptosystem for the receiver's public key in BIP 21.
- Adam's feedback prompted this update, prioritizing simple experience and fund security.
- The revised BIP aims to prevent fund loss while facilitating an asynchronous user experience.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin (AdamISZ)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email suggests that the URI version of base64 is recommended for QR codes.
- QR libraries treat base64 and URI versions as binary data, doubling QR density.
- UR encoding is efficient for QR codes and supports animation for large data.

recent_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed, addressing channel backups.
- It introduces a new type of channel funding transaction with additional spending paths.
- The proposal also discusses fraud proofs, saving bandwidth, and concluding remarks on device usage.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- The email proposes reevaluating a post-PTLCs scenario and implementing classic keysend as MPP.
- CLN and LDK already support this feature, and it would be beneficial for others to do so as well.
- Recipients can choose to claim less than the amount sent, while the sender considers the payment claimed once sent.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- The team has been recording and transcribing bi-weekly specification meetings throughout the year.
- The records are shared for others to use and can be accessed at https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification.
- Gurwinder from Chaincode manually checks the transcripts for accuracy.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- Statechains will implement a blinded version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2.
- The server (party 1) will be fully blinded and won't learn sensitive information.
- Security in blinded statechains relies on trusting the server and client-side signature verification.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- A new second-layer protocol called Ark has been released as an alternative to Lightning.
- Ark uses virtual UTXOs and does not require opening and closing channels.
- Users can acquire vTXOs from others or lift on-chain UTXOs for off-chain payments.

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets can be compromised or lost, leading to addresses being easily lost forever.
- Silent Payments allow safe multiple payments, but addresses need expiration to avoid mistakes.
- Adding a 3-byte field to addresses encodes an expiration date for usability and safety.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan discussed at the summit to conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting anonymized forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing local reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized, and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
active_posts.summary:
- The annual specification meeting took place in New York City in late June.
- Attendees tried taking transcript-style notes, available at this link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MZhAH82YLEXWz4bTnSQcdTQ03FpH4JpukK9Pm7V02bk/edit?usp=sharing.
- The notes aim to capture discussions, not provide a concise summary, with no speaker identification.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network provide privacy benefits for receiving nodes.
- Payments can only be made through given paths, potentially favoring "compliant" nodes.
- Concerns include decreased decentralization, compromised privacy, and pressure from "chain analysis" companies.
